meanings.definition: In a manner characteristic of a ghoul.
meanings.sent1: The monster moved ghoulishly through the dark forest.
meanings.sent2: She stared ghoulishly at the spooky decorations.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled ghoulishly as they pretended to be ghosts.
meanings.sent4: The shadows danced ghoulishly on the walls, creating an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house was decorated ghoulishly with fake cobwebs and skeletons.

meanings.definition: In a manner suggesting an interest in death or the macabre.
meanings.sent1: The horror movie fans ghoulishly awaited the release of the new film.
meanings.sent2: He ghoulishly collected antique skulls and bones.
meanings.sent3: The gothic novel was ghoulishly entertaining, keeping readers on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent4: Her fascination with crime scenes was ghoulishly intriguing to her friends.
meanings.sent5: The author's writing style was ghoulishly dark and captivating.
